Class AdminController

java.lang.Object
com.example.ajilore.code.controllers.AdminController
public class AdminController extends Object
Controller responsible for all administrative operations within the application.

This class acts as the bridge between the Admin UI and the Firebase backend (Firestore and Storage). It implements the logic for browsing, filtering, and removing domain entities (Events, Users, Images) and ensures data consistency (e.g., removing associated images when an event is deleted).

Supported User Stories:

  • US 03.04.01: Browse Events (fetchAllEvents(com.example.ajilore.code.controllers.AdminController.DataCallback<java.util.List<com.example.ajilore.code.ui.events.model.Event>>))
  • US 03.05.01: Browse Profiles (fetchAllUsers(com.example.ajilore.code.controllers.AdminController.DataCallback<java.util.List<com.example.ajilore.code.models.User>>))
  • US 03.06.01: Browse Images (fetchAllImages(com.example.ajilore.code.controllers.AdminController.DataCallback<java.util.List<com.example.ajilore.code.models.ImageItem>>))
  • US 03.01.01: Remove Events (removeEvent(java.lang.String, com.example.ajilore.code.controllers.AdminController.OperationCallback))
  • US 03.02.01: Remove Profiles (removeUser(java.lang.String, com.example.ajilore.code.controllers.AdminController.OperationCallback))
  • US 03.03.01: Remove Images (removeImage(com.example.ajilore.code.models.ImageItem, com.example.ajilore.code.controllers.AdminController.OperationCallback))
  • US 03.07.01: Remove Organizers (removeOrganizer(java.lang.String, com.example.ajilore.code.controllers.AdminController.OperationCallback))
  • US 03.08.01: Review Notification Logs (fetchNotificationLogs(com.example.ajilore.code.controllers.AdminController.DataCallback<java.util.List<com.example.ajilore.code.models.NotificationLog>>))
Version:
2.0
Author:
Dinma (Team Quartz)

  • Method Details

    • fetchAllEvents

      public void fetchAllEvents(AdminController.DataCallback<List<Event>> callback)
      Fetches all event documents from Firestore. User Story: US 03.04.01 - Browse Events
      Parameters:
      callback - DataCallback returning list of events or an error.

    • fetchAllUsers

      public void fetchAllUsers(AdminController.DataCallback<List<User>> callback)
      Fetches all user profiles from Firestore and converts to User model. User Story: US 03.05.01 - Browse Users/Profiles
      Parameters:
      callback - DataCallback returning the user list or error.

    • removeEvent

      public void removeEvent(String eventId, AdminController.OperationCallback callback)
      Removes an event and corresponding poster image from Firestore and Storage. User Story: US 03.01.01 - Remove Events
      Parameters:
      eventId - Event document id to delete.
      callback - OperationCallback for success/error handling.

    • removeUser

      public void removeUser(String userId, AdminController.OperationCallback callback)
      Removes a user profile from Firestore. User Story: US 03.02.01 - Remove Profiles Note: This permanently deletes the user document. For organizers, use removeOrganizer() instead.
      Parameters:
      userId - User's document ID.
      callback - OperationCallback for success/error.

    • removeOrganizer

      public void removeOrganizer(String organizerId, AdminController.OperationCallback callback)
      Atomically removes an organizer, bans them, and flags all their events. This ensures policy violations are enforced strictly.

      Actions Performed in Batch:

      1. Flags all events created by this organizer (status="flagged").
      2. Creates a record in 'banned_users' with the device ID.
      3. Deletes the user profile from 'users' collection.
      Parameters:
      organizerId - The Firestore ID (Device ID) of the organizer.
      callback - Callback for success/error.

    • getOrganizerEvents

      public void getOrganizerEvents(String organizerId, AdminController.DataCallback<List<Event>> callback)
      Fetches all events created by a specific organizer. User Story: US 03.07.01 - Remove organizers that violate app policy This can be used to display organizer event activity before deactivation. NOTE: Uses "createdByUid" field to match your Event model!
      Parameters:
      organizerId - The organizer's user ID
      callback - DataCallback returning list of events or error

    • fetchAllImages

      public void fetchAllImages(AdminController.DataCallback<List<ImageItem>> callback)
      Fetches all images (event posters AND profile pictures) from Firestore. User Story: US 03.06.01 - Browse Images
      Parameters:
      callback - DataCallback returning list of ImageItems or an error.

    • removeImage

      public void removeImage(ImageItem imageItem, AdminController.OperationCallback callback)
      Removes an image (event poster OR profile picture) from Storage and Firestore. User Story: US 03.03.01 - Remove Images
      Parameters:
      imageItem - The ImageItem containing the image URL, ID, and type
      callback - OperationCallback for success/error handling.

    • fetchNotificationLogs

      public void fetchNotificationLogs(AdminController.DataCallback<List<NotificationLog>> callback)
      Fetches notification logs for administrative review.

      Implements US 03.08.01: Queries the `admin_notification_logs` collection, ordered by timestamp descending (newest first).

      Parameters:
      callback - Callback returning a list of NotificationLog objects.
